alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 6:48PM CST until December 17 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, McIntosh and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcalester... Eufaula... Stigler... Warner... Porum... Webbers Falls... Crowder... Whitefield... Canadian... Indianola... Hanna... Arrowhead State Park... Vivian... Raiford... Enterprise... Briartown... Scipio... Vernon... Arpelar... - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 271 and 285. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
